issues.description: The problem statement's UML diagram and text specify the 'name' attribute of the 'Animal' class as a 'String', but the solution repository implements it as a 'StringBuilder'. This discrepancy in data type could confuse students when implementing the class based on the problem description.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the type of the 'name' attribute in the solution repository's 'Animal.java' to 'String' as specified in the problem statement, or update the problem statement to reflect the use of 'StringBuilder'.

issues.description: The 'singFarmSongVerse' method in the template repository has its 'Animal animal' parameter commented out, while the problem statement's UML clearly defines this parameter and the solution repository correctly implements it. This forces students to uncomment or re-add the parameter, which is an unnecessary hurdle given the explicit UML definition.
issues.suggested_fix: Uncomment the 'Animal animal' parameter in the 'singFarmSongVerse' method signature within 'Farm.java' in the template repository.
